messages.title: Better hospitals. Safer streets. Improved schools.
messages.content: It comes down to your vote.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Get Brexit done so we can move on with other priorities.
Investing an extra £33.9 billion, reducing waiting times, hiring more doctors and nurses.
Hiring 20,000 new police officers to tackle crime and break up drug gangs.
Greater funding for every school student and raising standards.
Boost local investment in Salisbury and Amesbury, and support economic growth.
Focus on reducing commute travel and improving infrastructure.
Protect the local environment and promote renewable energy.
Improve the vibrancy of Salisbury as a leisure and retail destination.
Advocate for community transport and ensure remote areas have access to help when needed.

issues.economy: We have now in a position to boost investment.
issues.education: Raising standards and further enriching the education of children in South Wiltshire.
issues.environment: Protecting the local environment is the greatest treasure.
issues.health: Investing an extra £33.9 billion into the NHS.

leaflet.personalStatement: I am very proud of the Government's record nationally and here in Salisbury and South Wiltshire.

politicalExperience.role: Conservative Candidate for Salisbury and South Wiltshire

images.caption: John Glen working for Salisbury and South Wiltshire.
